15311.title: Terra?

choices: Just keep moving, exit off the ship already
153111.content:
"Mmm..."

In one of the countless rooms within the great ship Halberd, Terra slowly awakens. A new day was set to begin, and, as always, he was ready to make the best of it. Yawning and stretching, the green puff slowly rolled himself out of the bed he slept in, and looks around warily. The room still wasn't very lit right now, so it was clear that it was, at the very latest, early morning.

Regardless, he was up and awake at this point. What reason would he have to sleep in?

After a brief wait, Terra walked briskly into the hallway and made his way toward the back of the mighty ship, where he can exit off the ramp.

However, before continuing down to the ramp, the green puff paused for a second. As usual, Meta Knight was most likely awake and somewhere near the cockpit. Perhaps he should find the masked knight, first...
153111.title: The story begins

choices: Take a brief tour around the town
1531112.content:
"Eh, it's not as if he worries about me that much anyway..."

Terra didn't wait a moment longer before continuing outside, not even doing so much as looking back.

Upon walking away a distance, the green puff looked back at the ship, just barely seeing the sun about to rise above it. 'Heh, too bad I don't wake up regularly at this time,' he began to think as he turned around and continued walking. '...It's a real nice sight...'

After a while, Terra came to a stop by the small town before him. He wasn't too familiar with anything regarding it, despite his proximity to it, simply because he was either in Kirby's cabin, or in the Halberd; either way, he was on the outskirts, where he was mostly undisturbed by the inhabitants.

Of course, he did have one fond memory involving those townsfolk, when they were persuaded to be rid of him by "His Majesty," Dedede, upon their mutual realization of the green puff's true secret.

Shaking his head, he dismissed the recurring memory once again. That wasn't important to him any longer, now that he's made proof of himself to be a bona fide Star Warrior. Of course, he knows that he's slipped a few times, but he still attempts to push back those regrets. The injuries he could've avoided dealing. The attacks and destruction he could've stopped...

Frowning now, Terra looked away from the town. He quickly began to try and think of something else to do to occupy his mind...
1531112.title: No need to let him know...

15311121.content:
Turning around completely, facing away from the town, Terra began to quickly amble off, towards Kirby's cabin. If he ever started to feel somewhat at odds toward himself, the pink puff himself was the one he'd always go to. Terra was sure he was still asleep in his abode, but for now, that didn't matter too much. After all, Kirby's been known to wake up at times way earlier than even Meta Knight would.

...Sure, they're few and far between, but they're still worth stating.

After a few more minutes of trudging along the field, the green Star Warrior finally made it to Kirby's cabin. Upon opening the door, he found the pink puff...
15311121.title: Checking on Kirby

153111211.content:
A light knock, and an open door later, and Terra has his expected answer. There Kirby was, lying down and tucked into his covers, quietly snoring away on his bed.

Smiling, the green puff walked in, being careful to close the door behind him quietly, and sat on the bed beside his closest friend. He didn't feel right waking the pink Star Warrior up yet, but was perfectly content with sitting and waiting. He placed a hand on Kirby's head, still continuing to smile. Even without saying a word to him, it seemed as if anything Terra was worried about wouldn't matter at that point. Then again, some could certainly consider Kirby as Terra's anchor to his own mental state, especially given what he hides within himself.

---

An hour has now passed. The sun has certainly risen above the horizon at this point, and it was apparent through the light passing into the small abode...
153111211.title: Do not disturb...

1531112112.content:
As Terra continued to wait quietly, a sudden quake threw him off-balance, causing his light body to collide into a nearby wall (which wasn't exactly hard to do, given the rather small amount of space in the room itself).

Of course, this quake and consequent collision was more than enough to jolt Kirby awake; he responded rather quickly, jumping out and quickly looking about for anything suspicious.

"Urgh..." Terra, now face-down on the ground, was a little slow to get up, but saw Kirby now more than wide awake.

"Terra?" Somewhat surprised to see the fellow Star Warrior here, Kirby hesitated for a moment before asking the obvious. "What in the world was that?"

"I-I don't know," he responded, finally getting up and walking towards the door, before another quake struck. A bit more prepared, though, he didn't fall down this time around.

Kirby, on the other hand, fell forward, straight into Terra, sending them both out the door as it was forced open by their collective inertia.

The two tumbled outside, and were immediately able to see the source of these quakes...
1531112112.title: Oh no...

choices: "Let's go in. We can't afford to wait."
"You're right. We should be careful and wait."
15311121121.content:
"What the...?" Terra was the first of the two of them to speak, as they both stood in front of what was obviously some sort of void or portal. "Is this a--"

"This is a gateway to another world, yes."

"What?" Looking away from the portal, the green puff saw Meta Knight walking towards the two. "When did you get here?"

"I figured that you would encounter one eventually."

"Meaning?"

"Yeah, what Terra said!" Kirby chimed in. "You know something about this thing?"

"I am sorry for keeping you in the dark here, you two, but I wished not to burden you two with this knowledge." The masked knight looked to Terra. "Especially you."

However, Terra had a quick response, sighing at first. "Regardless of how much I worry, Meta, I'd rather know than not. You should know this."

"I did not think much of this incident aside from having to find some source. However, it seems that I am wrong."

"What do you mean?" Terra gave a stern, expecting frown. "Are you talking something severe?"

In response, Meta Knight just turned away.

"...It is, isn't it."

He finally answered the question after a brief silence. "Truth be told, I do not know the severity of these gateways, nor do I know the implications of their existence. The only thing that I do know for sure is that there is some large-scale presence behind this."

Terra paused, and then sighed. "So you're saying that some hands-on investigation is in order."

"That is correct."

Kirby finally spoke up once again; although usually he was content with just listening, there was one question on his mind. "So, did you actually direct this gateway's, um..."

"I did not," the masked knight answered swiftly. "However, I did know that it would appear."

"Another question. How long have these been happening?"

"About a week. This is the ninth one that I can confirm having existed."

"That you can confirm?" Terra walked up closer to Meta Knight. "Does that mean that these gateways are--"

"Temporary, yes."

"Then we should hurry through this one if we're expecting it to close up!" The green puff began to rush into the portal, only to be stopped by the masked knight anyhow. "H-hey, what gives?!"

"Please, at least listen to everything I have to say. I have one warning, and it is that these portals are VERY unstable. Even if we were all to walk in at once, it is not a guarantee that we would end up in the same place."

"So? What's wrong with--"

"...Or anywhere at all."

The quick and blunt answer made Terra remain silent for a long while. Kirby was the first to ask anything about what the knight meant. "Um, can you explain what you mean...?"

"The void. An area of, essentially, non-existence. There is no time, no direction. It is said that those who are taken in by the void remain there forever, with no way to escape."

Gaining some backbone again to speak, Terra continued the thought himself. "So you're saying that it's possible that one--or all--of us could end up in the void."

Kirby spoke out what his close friend was very much thinking. "So what do we do, wait here until they get too troublesome? Plan an evacuation?"

"That is why I wish to ask you, Terra. What do you believe we should do?"
15311121121.title: It's a portal...!

choices: The three manage to stay together!
153111211211.content:
Looking straight into the portal, Terra shook his head slightly. "Sorry, Meta, but if something's really happening elsewhere, then I need to take a look."

"...I see." Surprisingly, he followed his brief answer with a chuckle.

"What's so funny, huh?"

"I truly should not have even asked. Whenever it comes to possible dangers, you always are so reckless."

"Now's not the time. If you're just trying to slow me down, you don't have to come with."

"Nonsense. I would do no such thing, and you know full well." He looked to Kirby. "So, I would suppose that you are coming along as well, no?"

"What kind of coward do you take me for?" The pink puff ran up to the two, smiling. "Of course I'm coming with!"

"Very well. In that case..."

"Let's go!" Terra, finishing Meta Knight's thought, rushed in headlong, without a care for the destination they may or may not arrive in.

Sighing, Meta Knight followed, as the always-excited Kirby rushed right behind...
153111211211.title: Impatience...

choices: "Let's see if Meta Knight wants to do something!"
153111212.content:
"Hey, Terra!"

The familiar pink puff's voice, startling Terra, came from behind him as he was about to open the door to the cabin.

"Wha...?!" Turning around slowly, Terra scanned the area behind him until he finally found Kirby, hanging down from the one tree immediately beside the small home.

"You lookin' for me, are ya?" Smiling plenty, the pink Star Warrior proceeded to swing a bit on the branch before letting go and landing a quick double backflip.

"Yeah," Terra began to answer with a skeptical air about him, "why else would I be here?"

"As if you haven't ever seen me just because," Kirby countered with a grin.

'...I can't say he's wrong...'

"So, what's up, then? You've got me, anyhow."

To that question, Terra started to look about nervously. "I just stopped by. What's wrong with that?"

Kirby, in response, gave a quick frown. "You think I haven't known ya long enough? C'mon, let's just forget whatever's wrong then. There's no need for you to worry!"

"...Whether you like it or not, the possibility--"

"Hey, it hasn't happened again, has it? Then quit being so worried!"

"Hmph." To that, Terra showed a brief smile. "F-fine. If it'll at least make you happy, there."

"Heheh, you're always too stressed."

"And you're always too relaxed."

"...I guess you could say that."
153111212.title: Something wrong?

choices: They look in the distance to see the Halberd under attack!
1531112122.content:
"...Sure. I'm down for that," Terra answered rather quickly. As much as he tends to not want to do anything when he's in such a state, he figured it would only help him.

"Perfect!" Kirby quickly grabbed his friend by the arm, and started to walk off with him. "Then let's walk over there!"

Terra couldn't do much more than chuckle at the pink puffball's antics. "You're always so quick to act, aren't you?"

"What? Is that such a bad thing?" Kirby looked back as he was pulling the fellow Star Warrior along, smiling and laughing. "C'mon, it's not like you don't know I do this!"

"You never stop surprising me." Terra began to laugh alongside Kirby, and began walking beside him as opposed to being practically dragged behind him.
1531112122.title: Heading back to the Halberd!

15311122.content:
Sighing, Terra looked back toward the town, and began to walk off towards it. He wanted to just take his mind off of his looming regrets. The beast inside of him was a powerful one, one capable of taking life and playing with it like a toy...

A stroll through the town wouldn't hurt.

After a good few minutes, Terra waltzes into the town.

...

'Weird,' Terra began to wonder as he waltzed through the town, 'I knew this town was kind of empty, but...' It's true; there wasn't a single soul, it seemed. This once semi-lively town felt more akin to a ghost town at this point.

After a while longer, he began to call out, his voice resonating throughout the entire town. Why wasn't there a soul here? There had to be a reason for this mass exodus...
15311122.title: Wandering around town

choices: The being is ready to finish wiping the town clean...including Terra...
153111221.content:
Before Terra could make any form of speculation as to what the rationale was behind everyone going missing, the answer presented itself, right there, plain as day.

A strange blue humanoid, floating slightly above ground, teleported right in front of the Star Warrior. Was this the being responsible for the disappearances?

'Only one way to find out...' Without hesitation, Terra summoned the Rainbow Sword to him, and held it in a heavy guard position, ready for a confrontation. "What...are you?"

The being didn't even give a single word back. It merely floated a good few feet away, readying some form of attack.

"Ech...!" Reacting on a whim, the green puff jumped back slightly and switched to his Ice element, quickly pounding the ground and causing a large wall of ice to come up in front of him. For insurance, he made sure to put his standard Ice Guard up, as well, still holding his blade in a guard position.

Red, energy-based wings started to materialize just behind the strange being, as the charging began to finish.

Terra, on the other hand, began to seem impatient. He knew the icy barrier wasn't gonna stay up forever on its own. 'C'mon, if you're gonna hit me...!'

For better or for worse, the humanoid launched its attack with devastating speed: a shockwave that ruptured all of the buildings around it, shattered the icy wall, and sliced through the near-impenetrable guard.

"G-gyah...!" Not expecting such a devastating result from the attack, the Star Warrior was immediately thrown off his feet, and hurtled straight into some of the rubble behind him.

"Ergh..." Despite the strong hit, though, Terra quickly stood himself up once again, now holding the blade in a more offensive position. "Hmph! Let's see how you deal with my counter...!" Switching to his Electricity element, the puff shot through in a sprint, at a speed that was difficult to follow with the unguided eye, on a collision course to the being. As soon as he got in range, he shot out even faster, dealing a Supersonic Lunge at it.

He was able to stab clean through the mysterious humanoid, but it didn't even seem fazed...
153111221.title: A strong foe...

choices: Terra points Fox to Kirby first
Terra points Fox to Meta Knight first
1531112211.content:
Terra started to panic, desperately trying to pull the blade out of the strange enemy. "Ergh, hah...! C-c'mon...!"

Finally, the humanoid being summoned an elliptical blade around its hand, and plunged it straight into the Star Warrior.

"Y-YAGH!" Heavily injured, and struggling to keep his grip on the Rainbow Sword, Terra still wouldn't give in to his pain. Continuing to pull, he finally manages to take the sword out, and uses it to slash the being back, causing him to be freed of the countering blade and fall hard to the floor.

"H-h-hah...h-hah..." Continuing to fight against his pains, the green puff stands up, only to see the humanoid before him charging another attack. Realizing this, he switches again to Ice and attempts another Ice Guard, but it's rather certain it wasn't going to block a thing.

But before the attack was fully charged, the sound of a humming jet engine was heard whizzing by. It was too quiet to be the Halberd taking flight, so what was it? Terra looked up to see the fresh afterburn of a jet having just passed through. 'What...?'

Confused and uncertain, the Star Warrior looked back towards the being he was facing to see a laser coming straight at him. Unable to move in his current state, he did the only thing he could manage...protect himself, lower his head, and brace for impact.

...

Brace for an impact, that never came. The laser was still audible, and rang deafeningly through Terra's ears. He could even hear it impacting some object, and yet he felt nothing pushing against him, or even harming him. Confused once again, he raised his head and lowered his guard, to see a certain blue, hexagonal reflector completely negating the laser as if it were nothing. "What the...?!"

After a few more seconds had passed, the laser finally began to dissipate, and, in reaction, the reflector started to dissipate as well, revealing a strangely human-like fox, clearly with a knack for weaponry and technology that the Star Warrior himself had no familiarity with. First a blue phantom-like human attacking him, and now an anthropomorphic fox saving him? Today certainly wasn't going to be a normal day, by any means.

The fox, who seemed to come out of nowhere, finally broke the strange silence. "Huh. Seems I got here just in time."

"What in Nova's name...?! Who are you, and what are you doing here?!"

"The name's Fox. Fox McCloud. I assume you must be Terra. I don't have much time to explain, but I'm here to help you guys get out of here."

"E-excuse me...?!" Obviously taken aback by this sudden statement, the Star Warrior began to grow frustrated with this apparent ally he just met. "I-I demand an explanation as to why!"

"I'm sorry. That's just something I don't have time to tell you completely, but, it has to do with Tabuu being here."

"Tabuu...is that the name of that thing...?" Terra once again raised his sword, threatening to turn against Fox. "How do you know of it?!"

"I'm telling you, just trust me! We don't have much longer before it'll destroy the entire place, and us along with it!"

"Wh-what...?!"

"Now will you work with me?! I promise you that I won't hurt any of the three of you, but..."

"Hmph...! Fine!" At this point more annoyed than anything else, Terra turned around and, switching back to his Electricity element, started to sprint, before falling flat on his face due to his injuries. "G-gah..."

"Hm." Seeing the Star Warrior in obvious pain, Fox grabbed him, tucking him beneath his arm before running off himself. "Just tell me where they are. The sooner, the better!"

"...Right..."
1531112211.title: A new ally?

choices: Terra comes to shortly, as Pop Star is falling apart on itself!
Terra comes to in some other place...
1531112212.content:
The strange being summoned the red wings from before, preparing yet another shockwave, sure to level the entire town, and then some, while also dealing more than enough damage to Terra to put him out of commission for good.

"Gah...!" Panicked, the green Star Warrior switched to his Fire element, and began hectically slashing at the being, holding nothing back in his assault. However, nothing seemed to even make it flinch as it continued to charge the attack, a shockwave far more powerful than the first.

"C'mon!" Continuing to pummel the being with attacks, he looked for any signs of progress in the slash barrage.

That progress, though, was nowhere to be found, and the humanoid finally completed charging the full shockwave, immediately sending it outward to collide into Terra.

Try as he might, he had no remaining guard after the slash assault to defend against the full-power shockwave, taking the complete force of its attack and being sent flying far, its impact...knocking him out instantly.
1531112212.title: The day of reckoning...

choices: They made it there; now to get outta here!
15311122121.content:
It didn't take too long for Terra to regain consciousness, awoken by the intense rumbling he's experiencing around him. "Wh-what the hell...?"

Stumbling to his feet, the green Star Warrior looks to see most of the landscape around him completely leveled and barren. Looks like that holographic creature did a number to the place after taking him down.

Terra hesitated for a moment before realizing what these quakes were signifying, as he noticed some small fissures forming. "Oh, Nova, this can't be good!" Within seconds, he switched to his Electricity element, made a 180, and dashed away from the city, towards Kirby's small cabin out in the distance, now cursing how far he lived from the town itself.

He got himself there within a few minutes, and kicked the door down, knowing full well that if Kirby wasn't outside right now, that he was still sound asleep.

"Kirby!" He quickly yelled into the small cabin as he walked to the pink puffball's bed. "We've gotta get to the Halberd! NOW!"

"Hm...?" Slow to wake himself up, Kirby was still completely unaware of the situation. "What're you talking about, Terra? We don't need to--"

"Pop Star's starting to fall apart! You remember the phantom star story you told me once?! Think of it like that!"

Even for the normally cool-headed and naive Kirby, that was enough to send him into a mini-panic, jumping right out of bed. "W-well why didn't you say so?! Let's go!" With that, he ran straight out the door, expecting Terra to follow.

"Hm, if only you could always have that sense of urgency about you...!" The fellow Star Warrior sped off after him, as they both headed to the Halberd closeby...
15311122121.title: Pop Star's collapsing!

153111221211.content:
"Come on! We're almost there!" Terra, running considerably ahead of Kirby, called back to try to hurry him up.

Clearly out of energy, the pink Star Warrior still attempted to try and speed up one notch, knowing that it was either do that, or risk losing more time as the world collapsed. "I-I'm t-t-trying...!"

"Hm." Skidding to a halt, Terra waited for Kirby to reach him once again, immediately grabbing him and holding him up. "Just hold on!"

"Ah...!" Taken slightly by surprise, he wasted no time following his close friend's order regardless and trying to stay piggybacked as they prepared to go as fast as they possibly could. "Right, ready!"

"Perfect." The green puff focused for a brief moment, before facing towards the barely-visible Halberd and taking off at a nearly Mach-1 level speed. He knew he wasn't going to get to the Halberd with any energy left, but he just had to get there as quickly as possible. Meta Knight is very vigilant. Surely, he should already know the situation being presented to them.

...

A small while passes, before Terra finally makes it to the ship, tumbling in fatigue in front of the ramp leading up to it and sending Kirby hurtling forth as well. "Ungh..."

A familiar voice from just inside rang out. "Take them both inside, now! We must depart!"

"M-Meta..." It was the last thing Terra heard and said, before passing out from overexertion, his entire body going fully limp despite his intentions.
153111221211.title: Barely making it!

choices: "...he is projected to stay unconscious for hours."
1531112212111.content:
A few hours have passed, and Terra is still out cold. Now, he's on one of the beds within the Halberd's infirmary, as the ship continues to venture out, away from the collapsing planet that was their home.

Kirby still stays waiting by his friend's side, ready to relay to him that they at least made it away from the planet, and also ready to ask what exactly went on, and if he knew what caused this whole issue to begin with. He looked out one of the windows that showed the outside, showing the beauty of the space they were traveling, but also reminding him that they certainly weren't returning to Pop Star any time soon.

Not much longer passed before the door leading to the infirmary opened, and Meta Knight stepped in himself. "So, he still has not awakened."

Kirby shook his head. "Guess he wasted a lot of energy."

"Hm." The masked knight looked down for a second, before facing Kirby once again. "What happened to cause this?"

"That's what I wanna know. If anyone does, it's Terra. He's the one who ran to me and got us both over here in time."

"I see." He hesitated. "I have also come here to inform you that we are safely away from any dangers. If you wish to move to the deck, then feel free to--"

"No thanks, Meta, but I'm sticking here until Terra wakes up."

"...You know, it is not as if he is in critical condition. Besides..."
1531112212111.title: Continue...

choices: "We try to find a landing point for the ship."
"We are going to pay a visit to a certain someone..."
15311122121111.content:
Meta Knight chuckled slightly. "I am certain that he will regain consciousness in but a moment."

"Really?" Kirby's eyes lit up upon hearing that.

"None of his injuries were too severe, although I am curious myself as to what caused them to begin with. While he did also overexert himself bringing you here, it is clear that someone or something harmed him outright."

"What do you think it is, then?" The pink puff looked to the knight quizzically. "You have any clues?"

"Not a single one, but something large-scale is at play here. Terra's wounds are ones I have not seen dealt before."

"As in, this is something not from Pop Star?"

"Correct. I suspect that it is also the same being that put our world to ruin as effortlessly as it did."

"Hm..."

After the two fell silent for a short while, Terra slowly began to regain consciousness, just as Meta Knight had said. "Ungh..." Opening his eyes slowly, he realized where he was and tried to get to his feet, only to reel back in significant pain. "Agh...!"

Looking to the injured one, the masked knight responded immediately, trying to keep him stable as he was slowly lowering back to a lied down position. "Please, be calm."

"M-Meta! Are we all--"

"We are all fine, yes."

Terra gave a quick sigh before continuing. "Good. Then all of my effort was worth it."

"Hey, Terra," Kirby chimed in, "glad to see you're up at least."

"The feeling's mutual." The green puff gave a small smile.

"If you are feeling up to it, could you please tell us everything that had happened?"

"...It's only right that I tell you. I probably know a bit more than you guys do, although I don't think that's really saying too much on my knowledge."

"Any small part will do, anything that can even give me a clue as to what was going on. What caused your injuries, for instance?"

"Um..." Terra gave a brief frown, thinking over how to answer. "Maybe if I could even describe what that was to begin with, I could give you an answer. It was, uh, some blue beast of sorts?"

"A blue...beast? Can you give any more information regarding that?"

"Well, it seemed like it was just really a holograph. None of it looked fully real, but it definitely was. Maybe a ghost?" The green Star Warrior hesitated. "I'm sure you've already figured this as a possibility yourself if you could tell that something harmed me, but I'm pretty sure that it was the one that caused Pop Star's collapse."

"Hm, it seems that you are as sharp as ever. Yes, I have considered the possibility. In fact, I was continuing to think of the possibility as you were regaining consciousness." Meta Knight paused. "Is that all you know of your attacker?"

"Aside from the attacks it dealt, yes."

"I see. Do not worry, even that small amount of information may be of use."

"Right. So, what's our next course of action?"
15311122121111.title: An Early Awakening

choices: "And it seems that they were expecting us."
153111221211112.content:
"Um." Terra hesitated briefly, thinking for a small while before coming to an obvious conclusion. He convulsed back before confronting Meta Knight on his plan of action. "Okay, no. NO. We are not doing that."

"Believe me, I am just as unwilling to head straight into Nightmare's base of operations, but we have little choice." The valiant knight gave a long, drawn-out sigh.

"Surely, any other choice is better than that!"

"I wish to the heavens and back that I could agree. However, Nightmare specifically possesses one tool that we must attain to assess this situation, and that is the omniscience that his base holds."

"You don't think that he's behind all this, do you?"

"Whether he is, I cannot answer to that. However, it is very likely that, regardless of the answer, Nightmare still likely holds more knowledge on who, or what, this attacker is than we do. And for now, attaining more knowledge is the key goal. Because it destroyed Pop Star with such voracity and efficiency, then we likely do not have much time on our hands."

"And if he is behind this?"

"Then it will make our job that much swifter."

"Boy, I'll admit, you seem real confident of this...plan...of yours, Meta. What part of it says this'll work?"

"I only stated that there is no better plan on hand," the knight corrected. "The fact is that, as our situation currently stands, we cannot afford to be picky in our methods. I know full well that Nightmare will do anything but welcome our arrival, and will perhaps be fully expecting it, but we truly have no better option. Please, Terra, grant me your trust with this course of action."

Terra groaned in initial response, shutting his eyes and pondering over the decision. He knew Meta Knight had a point. On every account, even. They couldn't even think of combating that entity by themselves, and even if they did believe that they could, they still wouldn't be about to pull it off without gaining more information on that apparition, and Nightmare, like it or not, was their only known source for that information. They had to give it a shot.

With an elongated sigh, the green puff shook his head, finally giving an answer. "Like you said, I wish we didn't have to, but we obviously do. Let's go."

"Very well. We should be arriving soon, so I suggest you two get ready to fight."

Surprisingly, despite staying completely silent the whole time, Kirby was the first to answer. "Hah! Thought you'd never ask!"

Both he and Terra raised one arm up, attempting to call upon their weapons of legend, the Star Rod and Rainbow Sword.

...But, neither one showed, eliciting a facepalm from Terra. "Of course we wouldn't be able to call for them," he spoke in a somewhat soft tone. "They were both likely destroyed with Pop Star!"

"Oh, right."

"If that is the case," Meta Knight calmly intervened, "then we must simply be more careful than we even initially planned. Stay cautious, as we are approaching the base..."
153111221211112.title: Revisiting a Nightmare

choices: "It's for the best..." Kirby decides to run ahead and leave Terra.
"I'm not leaving without you!" Kirby stays behind to try and get them both out.
153111221212.content:
"C'mon! Hurry!"

Speeding past Kirby, Terra turned around, still running backwards, trying to let Kirby keep with him.

"Gah, you know I can't keep with you without an ability! I'm going as fast as I can!" The pink puffball struggled, panting, trying to still run faster.

"Hmph...!" Terra stopped for a second to wait for him, before picking him up and carrying him in piggyback manner. "Alright, gotcha!" With that, he quickly sprinted off at full speed, with Kirby in tow.

However, even with Terra's speed, it didn't seem to be enough. A fissure came up from under them, immediately taking him by surprise.

"Agh...!" Reacting almost instantly, Terra reached to the nearest ledge the fissure caused, just barely able to cling on.

"A-ah!" In response, Kirby held on tighter to his friend. "T-Terra?!"

"Jump off, Kirby! I can't hold on much longer...!"

"What?!"

"I don't need to explain it! Just let go and jump!"

Even after being told again, Kirby was still hesitant. He was torn to go off without him...
153111221212.title: Uh oh...

choices: Kirby manages to pull Terra up!
1531112212122.content:
Kirby finally jumped off Terra, making his way over the fissure, but with a smile, he turned back and lied down over the edge of it, both hands hanging down towards Terra. "I'm not leaving without you."

"K-Kirby! I said go! NOW!"

Terra's outburst was met with a quick shake of the pink puff's head. "Not happening. I know I can get you outta here; just grab on!"

The fellow Star Warrior quickly realized that Kirby wasn't going to leave without him regardless of the chances, so he sighed, jumping up from his spot beneath the ground and grasping onto both outstretched hands, catching Kirby slightly off-guard with his weight and pulling him down slightly before he anchored his feet down and began pulling back against the additive weight.

"Urgh! I-I've, I've..." Immediately struggling, the puffball tried to get some leverage to lift Terra out, but was still sliding closer to the edge. He didn't have much time before the fissure took them both in.

Terra started to kick his feet about, trying to find some form of foothold to help Kirby bring him up, but to no avail. The portion he was at just didn't have anything steady enough...
1531112212122.title: Brotherly Bond...

choices: They make it to the ship without any added problems.
The being returns for round 2?! This is bad...!
15311122121221.content:
"I'm not letting go!" Persistent and unfazed, Kirby continued to pull against the opposing gravity, with even more vigor than before. "You trust me, right?"

"K-Kirby..." Terra calmed himself greatly as he began to feel Kirby actually pulling back, with some slight success. Each tug the young Star Warrior made pulled him up more and more each consecutive time. After a few more tugs, he was able to grasp onto a spot where he was easily able to jump out. Without hesitation, he held Kirby up and sped away. "Now to return the favor, and get us to the Halberd, post-haste...!"
15311122121221.title: Resilience pays off

choices: Two mice come into view?! (Pikachu and Pichu)
15311122122.content:
After an unknown measure of time, the green puff finally begins to come to after the crushing impact of that shockwave. Still plenty bruised and battered, he opened his eyes reluctantly to take the sight around him, only to quickly realize he wasn't in Pop Star anymore. He was in a tent of some sort, it seemed. He couldn't see much beside that cloth roof, however.

"Eh...?" Curious to figure out where he's ended up, the Star Warrior attempted to stand himself up, only to reel back in pain as he tried to even sit up. "U-urgh! Th-this pain..."

Seemingly in response to Terra's coming to, a voice now sounded from a blind spot in Terra's very limited vision. "Hm? He's awake? I thought he was dead..."

"I told you it'd be worth it to keep him around!" another voice exclaimed in response.

"H-huh?!" Terra attempted to look around slightly, only to reel back in pain yet again. "Agh..."

"Don't strain yourself. You're still plenty hurt."

"Hey, I think it'd at least be right for us to show him who we are, right?"

"...I guess."

The two voices finally reveal their owners...
15311122122.title: New surroundings

choices: "But it'd be best to try and heal before then."
"If you think you're okay, we can go right now."
153111221221.content:
Once the two voices were finished discussing over the matter, they both immediately looked over Terra, bringing them to his line of sight. They both seemed similar to one another, although one was clearly younger than the other.

"Heya!" the younger one quickly exclaimed, smiling a bit. "Glad you're awake, finally!"

"F-finally?" Terra cocked his head slightly, still in pain. "What do you mean, finally? Where am I? Who are you two? Where's Kirby and Meta?! How long have I been--"

"Whoa, calm down," the older one cut the green puff off, "we'll answer all that and more, I promise." He hesitated. "Well, almost all of them. I'm not exactly sure who you mean by 'Kirby and Meta'. Are they friends of yours?"

"Yes." Terra spoke hesitantly. He wasn't very quick to just up and trust everyone he meets, much unlike his 'brother'. "But can you at least answer my first two questions?"

"Of course. The first thing I should answer is who we are. I'm Pikachu..."

"And I'm Pichu!" the smaller, younger mouse added. "We're brother and sister!"

"...Yes, we are." Judging from the slight surprise on Pikachu's face, it's clear that he wasn't expecting his younger sister to butt into the conversation just then. "As for your other question, we were both pretty shocked to even see you open your eyes again. We tried all sorts of berry and seed mixes, and not a single one of them worked even a bit to help you heal."

'Well, of course they wouldn't work,' Terra began to think to himself. 'They'd never be able to work on me...'

"Anyway, we've been housing you for two weeks."

Two weeks. The thought of that length of time bounced around in Terra's mind for a bit before it finally clicked, and the reality of that crashed down. "WHAT?!" Completely ignoring his injuries this time, regardless of the severe pain, he jumped up to his feet. "Did you just say two weeks?!"

"Whoa, whoa, calm down, please. That's not exactly helping..."

With a sigh, Terra quickly sat down. "Okay, fine..."

"I'm actually surprised, though. You got out almost without a problem. Maybe you'd like an Oran Berry?" Pikachu shuffled through a bag he had with him, until he finally got a small, plump berry with a blue hue to it out and showed it to the puff.

"Um, I'll pass."

"You sure?" the sister once again interrupted. "It's good for you, promise--"

"Hey, don't worry about this, Pichu." Pikachu pointed outside. "How about you go out and play for now?"

"Okay!" She went hastily outside, without question.

"Whew, at least now I can try to explain everything. I'm sorry you had to deal with her."

Terra simply smirked at the mouse's comment. "I'm more used to dealing with that level of energy than you think."

"Huh, is that right." Pikachu quickly shook his head. "Well, we'll talk about that stuff some time later, um..." He then blushed lightly, embarrassed. "Sorry, but I don't think I actually caught your name."

"Oh, right!" The puff stood himself up once again, although he started to cringe in pain, and held out his hand. "Th-the name's Terra," he stammered through clenched teeth. Now that the small adrenaline boost was over, he was once again feeling that harsh pain that was forcing him to stay lying down before. That didn't keep him from trying, though, as he extended his hand towards the small yellow mouse. "A pleasure to meet you."

Pikachu hesitated for a while before finally extending his own forepaw to Terra and shaking hands. "Right. Nice to meet you." He then quickly made a motion as to tell the puff to sit himself down. "Seriously, though, you need a bit more rest. What's the rush?"

"Well, I-I still don't know if Kirby and Meta are okay...!"

Frowning, Pikachu asked a similar question. "How did you get yourself so hurt?"

"It was a sudden attack. Our attacker...we have no clue who it was. It appeared out of nowhere, and took me out as easily as anything."

"Sounds kinda nasty...and I'm sorry for your friends."

"Don't be."

"Anyway, I'd be happy to help you, then." Pikachu then managed a small smile, trying to comfort Terra.
153111221221.title: Two mice come into view?! (Pikachu and Pichu)

1531112212211.content:
"But..." Pikachu's voice trailed off, as Terra gave a brief sigh.

"You want me to stay and heal, right?"

"Um, yeah. I'd rather you stick in here until you're 100 percent. There's no real reason to rush."

"...While I'd beg to differ, I get what you mean." While he gave a little bit of a frown, Terra knew deep down that the two really cared for his safety more than anything else right now. Of course he was worried about Meta Knight and Kirby, who are probably searching around for him, but it'd be best to make certain that he could make it back.

"Thanks. I know it's hard when your friends are in such a tight spot, but--"

"It's the best course of action. I get it," the green puff answered despondently.

"R-right, sorry to touch a nerve."

"Don't worry. I'll be fine. Just let me rest a bit longer, that's all. I'd appreciate if neither of you two spoke to me for a while."

"...Alright, I'll let you have that wish." Smiling, Pikachu called to Pichu, who was somewhere along the other side of the room. "Hey, let's go ahead and do some errands while we're at it!"

"Sounds good to me," Pichu cried out, rushing to Pikachu's side as the two strolled out of the room.
1531112212211.title: Trying to heal up...

choices: They were in the middle of a forest.
1531112212212.content:
With a heavy sigh, the mouse continued. "If you're up to it, we can start trying to help you back right now."

"You mean it?" Terra cocked his head to the side, somewhat confused.

"You've been trying to get out to search for your friends this whole time. I'm sure if I left you alone, you'd take the opportunity and bolt."

The puff hesitated for a good while before finally shrugging. "You're not wrong."

"Figured." With that, Pikachu began to walk out the tent. "So, you set, or what?"

"Yeah." Terra began to follow the mouse out the tent.
1531112212212.title: Hasty exit

choices: Keep your presence from creating an incident here! Ask for the disguise.
Pikachu said you probably wouldn't be suspected. Decline the offer.
15311122122122.content:
As soon as Terra stepped outside with Pikachu, he noticed a rather urbanized area around him. Buildings, crowds. Was this what he thought it was?

"So this is...a town of sorts?" Terra looked to Pikachu, concerned. "I'm obviously a foreigner here. Are you sure that everyone here will take kindly to my presence?"

"I'm...actually not entirely sure," he answered very matter-of-factly. "You're definitely not a human, at the very least. Maybe they won't suspect much of you--" Before he finished his statement, he took one more quick look at Terra. "...Say, you look like one of us Pokemon, now that I take a good look at you."

"Eh? How do I look like one of you mice? And what's a 'hue-min'?"

Pikachu gave a rather hearty laugh in response, as if the puff had said something very irrational. "We might look like that, but we come in all sorts of different forms! We're still discovering more and more of each other as years pass!" He seemed to intentionally avoid his follow-up question.

"You are? That's rather insane, isn't it?"

"Heheh, eventually, you just kinda get used to it."

"I see. So, getting back to the topic at hand..."

"Oh, right. You remind me a lot of Jigglypuff, actually."

"Jigglypuff?" Terra remained significantly confused. "What's that?"

"Explanation later. My point is that we could make a disguise for ya until you gain people's trust around here. It'd just be a small change in looks, promise." He hesitated for a second. "But, it's up to you. I'm not sure if it'll be absolutely needed, myself."

The green puff started to mull over the decision. To conceal himself, or not to; which should he choose?
15311122122122.title: They resided in a town.

153111221221221.content:
"Well, alright," Terra finally answered, "I suppose it won't hurt--UWAH...!"

The puff was cut off as Pikachu grabbed him and began to run off (or, at least, ran off as fast as he could with only his hind paws), to somewhere near the outskirts of the town. "Great! Then let's get my sis again so she can help me out with this!"

"I-I thought you said it was a small thing!"

"Yeah, but I never said that I was the one who knew how to do it, now did I?"

Terra didn't answer back to that. He indeed had a point.

"Anyway, my sis, Pichu, knows how to do all that stuff incorporating a disguise, so much so that she's usually the go-to for anything involving that. She's much better than she looks."

"If the entire town looks up to her as such, I don't doubt it, but that still doesn't entirely explain why we have to go to her."

"Hey, I know her super well for obvious reasons, and we've always done favors for each other. That's just how we work."

"...If you say so."

Finally, the two arrived at the playing ground Pichu frequents the most, in very close proximity to a beach. The two scanned it for a second, only to realize it was missing the very one they were looking for.

"Pichu?" the older sibling called out reluctantly. "Are you here, sis?"

Terra looked to Pikachu curiously. "Are you sure this is where she normally goes off to play?"

"Yeah, I'm sure of i--"

Suddenly, a rustling of grass alerted the two to someone nearby.

"Tch...! Is that her...?"

"I'm...not sure. Sis?"
153111221221221.title: Better Safe Than Sorry

choices: They get back without a hitch, and start the disguise.
They get back, but are stopped by something...
1531112212212211.content:
To both Terra and Pikachu's relief, a familiar voice spoke through its cover. "Heehee, I scared you two, didn't I?"

Terra followed with a sigh. "Try not to do that, will ya? I've got to be on full alert just in case something comes my way here. I can't get you involved in them and risk getting hurt."

"I know how to fight, y'know." Pikachu gave a quick frown.

“Well, these are my problem.” As soon as he said that, he collapsed slightly under his weight.

The collapse was met with an almost immediate reaction from Pikachu, as he ran up to Terra rather alarmed. “Are you alright…?!”

The green puff struggled quite a bit to lift himself back up to his feet. “I’m fine, don’t you worry.”

“You’re obviously hurt. Stop your bluffing…”

“I said I’m fine…!”

The mouse just sighed heavily. “Well, whether what might come along is your problem or not, you’re not going to be able to fight them alone if this is your condition.”

“…I see I can’t dissuade you two.” Terra sighed slightly as well in response. “Hopefully, I’m wrong, and I’m safe here.”

“Right, so let’s not worry about all that nonsense,” Pichu answered, speaking up and putting on a rather innocent smile. “So, what’d you guys need me for, anyway?”

“Oh, right!” Pikachu gave a quick nod. “We need a little bit of help in getting Terra here to blend in a little better. Think you can do that?”

To the fellow sibling’s seeming lack of confidence, the young sister nearly gave a scorn, instead turning it into more of a standard frown. “C’mon, bro, of course I can do that! This is an easy one! I’m pretty sure I even have something ready for what you’re probably thinking of!”

“You do? Let’s get back home and get it set up as quickly as possible for him, then!”

With that, the three began to rush back, hoping to get this disguise done before Terra causes any commotion.
1531112212212211.title: Pichu emerges from nearby.

choices: This doesn't seem good...! Cut your losses and run!
1531112212212212.content:
Terra looked to his left to notice an odd figure approaching the two of them. "Um, Pikachu, this isn't looking too good..."

"What? Whaddaya--" As Pikachu turned his head, he knew immediately what the Star Warrior meant. "Ack...!" He got on all fours in an engaging position, electricity discharging from his red cheek pouches. "What the...?"

"Hmph." Terra's surprise from seeing the unnaturally dark figure soon disappeared, as he summoned his Rainbow Sword and held it to his side. "What are you?"

The figure, not answering with so much as a word, continued to approach the two, shooting out a net of dark energy at Pikachu.

The Star Warrior quickly intercepted the net, blocking it away with a slash of his blade. "I asked a question."

"Terra, is it really the best idea to--"

"That...is of no concern to you." The figure approached the two some more, shooting a large laser at the two. "Just succumb...to the darkness..."

"Hrrgh...!" Switching to ice, Terra sent the blade out, spinning like a shield to deflect the laser. "How about we don't."

"You just dared to defy the overwhelming power..."

1552.content:
Opening-Omnipotent view
Two warriors stood in the center of a shattered and ruined square…one was wearing green and wielding a beautifully crafted sword and a blue shield but facing him was another man in black knight’s armor wielding a sword nearly as long as he was tall in only one hand…this blade had been blessed by the church and was unbreakable. These two warriors stood there just staring each other down as the battle raged around him…but the square was the calm eye of this raging storm. Unbeknownst to either man there was a third lying prone on the roof of a building surrounding the square…he was targeting the man in the black armor, he was breathing slowly, and on his exhale of breath he…rolled out of the way barely dodging the powerful slash of a murasama. The man looked up to see a man with long silver hair wearing a long black leather coat.
“Hello…Magoichi,” the man taunted preparing to slash him in two…but his attack was intercepted by another man with one eye and wearing a Japanese helmet with a golden crescent on it…Date Masamune…the one eyed dragon of Oshu.
“Why don’t you run along Sephiroth,” Masamune taunted him…but he did not notice the man in the red leather jacket leap onto the roof from the other side of the square a longsword with a hand guard held tightly in his hand.
As the man approached Masamune another figure appeared on the roof intercepting the man in red’s attack. This newcomer was wearing green clothing and wielding two Chinese swords…this man was called Liu Bei.
“Genesis I will stop you in the name of virtue,” Liu Bei roared attacking Genesis, “Magoichi get out of here now and report to the princess.”
Magoichi nodded and took off sprinting across the rooftops…the two combatants standing in the square had not moved…they completely ignored the battle being waged on the rooftops…then the man in green twitched…a nearly imperceptible movement that was drawn out by the attack being launched by the man in black…he rushed at the man in green and struck with an immense amount of power forcing the green man back several paces…but then he stopped and stood still once more.
“Why don’t you fight back Link,” the man in black taunted, “What happened to vaunted courage?”
“Shut your mouth Dietrich,” Link hissed charging at Dietrich only to be met with cold steel…Link flinched expecting to feel his body separating into halves but when he opened his eyes he saw a man wearing a purple set of Soldier Armor and wielding a large sword…his name was Cloud Strife. Cloud swung horizontally at Dietrich but he simple ducked to avoid the attack…Cloud swung three times but each time Dietrich evaded them but on the last one he back flipped away…Royal Guardsmen flooded into the square hoping to finally capture Dietrich…but as they approached him the sound of gunfire ripped through the square…Shinra troopers had been hiding in the rubble and began gunning down any and all enemies. Cloud was shielding the wounded Link from the gunfire to the best of his ability but many bullets were hitting dangerously close to his downed ally…but then Magoichi rushed in with several of his renegades to provide fire support for the trapped Guards…and to extract Link and Cloud…all while this was going on Dietrich just stood there completely unfazed…

On the other side of the city Wu forces led by Sun Jian were closing in on a small group of PSICOM soldiers protecting several strange rings…as the Wu forces closed in on the PSICOM forces one of them began tapping buttons on his gauntlet which caused the rings to glow brightly…all of a suddenly beast leapt out of the portals…they looked like deformed wolves that had been armored in technologically advanced armor…but they were just as dangerous as they began shredding the now panicked Wu forces…Sun Jian was attempting to maintain order and bring his soldiers back in line but then the largest portal began glowing and from it leapt a huge beast that was almost as large as a ship…it was armored from head to toe and on its back was a set of gatling guns which it began firing…Sun Jian then lost complete control of his army at this point and seeing the battle was lost ordered the retreat…the PSICOM forces let out a cheer and the large behemoth reared back on its hind legs and roared…

Arumat and the White Knight were standing in the throne room their weapons drawn…Arumat was wielding a purple scythe with a green laser blade…the White Knight was wielding a common Broadsword...they were here to protect the princess who was sitting in her throne girded for war and a bare Rapier was sitting in her lap…the sounds of combat could be heard in the hallway…the clang of swords connecting with shields…the screams of dying men…and then silence…the battle in the hall way was over…the doors to the throne room were thrown open and in marched knights in white robes adorned with a black cross with black steel gauntlets, and horned helmets…the legendary Teutonic Knights…and the soldiers sent here to capture the princess.
“Are you ready kid?” Arumat inquired a small smile crossing his face, “Because they aren’t about to wait for us.”
With that Arumat charged the Knights quickly cutting down two of them as the White Knight appeared next to him and cut down two more…this battle would be to the death…

In another part of the City Wei Forces led by Cao Cao were engaged with evil Warlord Dong Zhou. The blue clad soldiers of Wei were going toe to toe with the purple clad soldiers of Dong Zhou…several officer could be seen fighting alongside the soldiers…Xiahou Dun, Xiahou Yuan, Cao Ren, and Sima Yi were all fighting against the enemy forces…and it looked like they were going to win…at least until Lu Bu intruded upon the battlefield along with his two lieutenants Zhang Liao, and Diao Chan. Panic spread through the Wei forces as they were butchered by the combined might of both Dong Zhou and Lu Bu…soon however Wei began retreating but before the evil forces could begin pursuing them Dietrich appeared before both Dong Zhou and Lu Bu.
“You are to let them go,” he ordered.
“Why should we let these weaklings go,” Lu Bu snarled in defiance.
“Because he ordered you to,” I deep dark voice grunted behind them.
As Dong Zhou and Lu Bu whirled around a huge man covered in armor with a bull horned helmet stepped out of the shadows in his hand a huge cleaver like sword…His name was Garland…
1552.title: two

15521.content:
The Last Teutonic Knight fell cleaved in two from a blow from Arumat. The bodies of the fallen littered the ground around us…some in various state of dismemberment others completely charred from fire and some just disintegrated. The White Knight gazed around the look of horror and disgust at the broken forms lying around us.
“Get used to it kid,” Arumat growled, “I’m Death Incarnate and as such those around me are prone to die...we should grab the princess and get out of here.”
They both ran towards the princess but stopped when they heard the tread of boots…as they whirled around they saw a group of Soldier 2nd class marching up the hall their blades bare and gleaming in the sunlight.
“Shit…We’ve got to get the doors closed,” Arumat shouted rushing towards the door, “These warriors make the Teutonic Knights look like peasants with pitchforks.”
The White Knight rushed towards the door alongside Arumat and helped him slam the doors shut and quickly locked them…knowing that this would only buy us a few minutes we grabbed the princess and ran…

In the airspace around the capital several PSICOM airships had closed on the city and began deploying their cannons to bomb the city…as the first one was charging its cannon several orange fighters fell from the clouds and opened fire on the airship damaging it but not grounding it…as they came around for another pass the airships open fire with their defensive gun shooting down several of the orange crafts...as the orange fighters were shot down one by one about three dozen blue needle nosed fighters dropped from the clouds and opened fire on the airships bringing the damaged one down in a flash of fire…and then the orange fighters came around to fire upon the remaining ships but they were met by volleys from the arriving PSICOM fighters and were reduced to nothing but fire and scrap…the fight for the airspace above the capital was now beginning…

The princess and her two guardians were rushing across a bridge connecting two towers together…under the tower they were heading towards was a secret passage that would lead them to the safety of an area outside of the castle…as they approached the tower an explosion roared to are left as one of the PSICOM airships exploded and as the other airships continued to fire on the fighters PSICOM fighters appeared and opened fire on our allies fighters…as we approached the tower one of the airships fired its main cannon and whether by luck or design its attack hit the bridge separating the White Knight from Arumat and the princess. The princess was unharmed but Arumat’s arm was injured and the blood streamed down it…the White Knight rose to his feet and turned as he heard the sound of tramping boots…approaching him was the Black Knight Dietrich accompanied by several Soldier 2nd classes, Shinra Troopers, and a couple Teutonic Knights…and the White Knight was separated from all of his allies…he was alone…utterly alone…

Cao Cao gazed at the city he had been sworn to defend break under the assault of the enemy commander…He had fled with his army and his officers to the nearby woods…they had been abandoned by their allies and the only reason that they had survived was that Dietrich had let them go…why?
“Something troubles you my lord?” Xiahou Dun inquired of his cousin.
“Yes…our allies have abandoned us,” Cao Cao sighed, “I must think on what to do next.”
“As you wish cousin,” Xiahou Dun stated signaling the army to begin moving, “To Xu Chang!”
Wei was abandoning the capital and heading for its home city of Xu Chang…many of its soldiers fed up with the little support they were receiving from their allies…Cao Cao was not one to be trifled with…

The Black Knight Dietrich was approaching the White Knight his sword glinting in the distorted sunlight…the smoke of the burning city choked the skies as the PSICOM airships bombarded it with their main cannons…but no smile was seen on his face just a defiant scowl. His gaze was focused not on the knight but on Arumat and the princess.
“Really Arumat is this how you greet a friend,” Dietrich laughed coldly.
“Dietrich,” Arumat gasped in disbelief, “But you’re dead…I saw you die.”
“Well you see Arumat what you saw was my body dying,” Dietrich Laughed, “but my soul lived on and allowed me to reconstruct my body.”
“Why?” The princess yelled, “Why would you serve Chaos!?”
“Because your crusade is doing nothing more than causing more pain,” Dietrich snarled, “I will bring order to this chaos and an end to this pathetic war.”
With that the twang of a crossbow sounded as one of the Teutonic Knights fired his crossbow striking the princess…but the crossbowman did not get a second shot off because Dietrich had rounded on him and cut him in two a scowl on his face.
“I told you the princess was to be taken alive,” Dietrich hissed, “Anyone who dares to defy me will be executed.”
As he turned towards his opponent the White Knight had already leapt across the gap to safety and fled with the other two leaving Dietrich behind.
“I see you lost them,” Genesis stated walking up behind Dietrich.
“It is only temporary,” Dietrich assured him, “After all heroes won’t let us go unpunished after all.”
With that they turned and walked away…leaving the princess to flee for her life…

The White Knight stood gazing at the city he had just arrived at burn under the attack of the armies of Evil…how could he forgive himself…he turned and walked towards his charge…the only hope for good…

155211.title: Characters

choices: Cao Cao wishes to discuss his surrender (darthvaapad)
1552111.content:
I walked down the now ruined halls of the palace as memories of my past here rushed over me…the tramp of my bodyguards boots echoed through the battle scarred halls…our allies were removing the bodies of the fallen and interrogating the wounded. I was approaching the throne room where he awaited…I stepped through the ruined doors without pause…during the battle Arumat had attempted to slow my forces down by sealing the doors but I simply blasted them off their hinges. I approached the throne where a giant four armed horned winged demon sat his head resting on one of his hands.
“89% of the city is secured my lord,” I stated with a slight bow, “There has been some resistance from the populace but they’ve been swiftly brought into line.”
“Good…good,” Chaos chuckled cruelly, “How many prisoners have been taken?”
“Four hundred twenty two,” I answered.
“Very good,” Chaos continued to chuckle cruelly, “I will send Garland to question them…but as for you we’ve heard that there are reports of an enemy commander in the woods nearby…you are to find and eliminate him.”
I nodded and left the throne room…as I descended the stairs I saw Sepiroth in a heated argument with Genesis but it quickly stopped at my approach.
“We’ve heard about the mission,” Genesis stated calmly, “and we’ve something we wish to tell you.”
“The enemy commander is Named Cao Cao,” Sepiroth stated, “He is a powerful warrior and skilled commander.”
“Yes and both Sepiroth and I agree that we should attempt to turn him rather than kill him,” Genesis stated.
“But we were debating whether we should include him in our group,” Sepiroth commented, “I told him we should wait and see while Genesis says we should recruit him into our group as soon as possible.”
“That descion is not yet to be made,” I told them, “Let us go.”
We set off to head for the nearby woods with are armies in tow fully expecting an ambush by enemy forces…but strangely there were none…yet the forest was utterly silent…I urged my mount forward to the head of my forces and as I reached the front I someone shouted at me.
“Halt!” a man in blue robes with an eye patch on a horse…in his hand was clutched a Padao, “My lord wishes to speak with you.”
“Who is your lord?” I inquired…though I already knew the answer, “and who are you?”
“Don’t lay dumb with me boy,” the man snarled, “My Lord is Cao Cao and I’m his lieutenant Xiahou Dun!”
“I will not come alone,” I hissed angrily, “I will only see your lord if I’m allowed to bring my lieutenants with me.”
“Fine…but if you try anything I will eliminate you personally,” Xiahou Dun snarled as all four of us urged our mounts through the forest.
As all four of us set out through the forest I glanced up into the trees where I saw archers attempting hide among the branches…all of a suddenly we entered a glade that had been fortified with palisades, ballista, and watchtower…and sitting on a wooden throne was a severe looking man in blue…a large golden sword leaning against the long table in front of him…now to find out why he wanted us here.
1552111.title: Black Knight (darthvaapad)

15521112.content:
“You’ve surrendered too easily Lord Cao Cao,” I smirked sitting down, “What is the true reason for this surrender?”
“I wish to defect to your forces Master Dietrich,” Cao Cao stated smirking slightly, “As I’m sure your spy network has informed you our allies abandoned us in the middle of combat.”
“Yes I’ve heard,” I answered, “But I doubt that is the only you’ve decided to ask to defect to my side…don’t bother lying I’m an excellent judge of character and as such I would guess that a man of your ambition would not willingly suffer anyone’s command but your own…so where do your ambitions drive you?”
“You are very acute with your guesses,” Cao Cao laughed, “I wish to end this chaos and restore peace to the land.”
“And you sought to use the princess for this…a pawn in your strategies,” I stated shaking my head and smiling, “That was foolish…she is too foolish and naïve to be of any real use.”
“I’m guessing you attempted to do this,” Cao Cao sighed.
“Yes…but when I realized she was too weak defeat Chaos so I sought to usurp her and take the throne,” I sighed despondently, “and as you can see I failed…slain before my uprising could even begin by a man I thought I could trust…but he betrayed me blinded by his loyalty…I thought he could see the way the wind blows but…it doesn’t matter anymore…but suffice to say I used my…talents…to survive and went to a place where my talents would be put to better use.”
“And since you joined Chaos the war has swung completely in his favor,” Cao Cao stated, “I do not care how this war ends as long it ends…So I here today before the witnesses of our two factions that I do hereby swear fealty to you Lord Dietrich for as long as I live.”
“I’d be careful what you promise Cao Cao,” I chuckled, “I’ll live nine times as long as any mortal man easily…but I am happy to have your assistance Lord Cao Cao…your loyalty shall be rewarded…I will create a land where reason rules and order is supreme…for that is both our dreams.”
As I stood to leave one of my messengers came charging into the encampment looking excited.
“Supreme Commander I’ve news on the princesses whereabouts,” he stated, “Her and her guards have waltzed into your trap….and there host has no idea of our intentions.”
“What is he talking about?” Xiahou Dun inquired walking up to me.
“The princess’s ineptitude has earned her the ire of many of her people…an ire I am exploiting,” I laughed, “The one who’s sheltering them is unaware that 90% of his followers are loyal to me and are ready to revolt against him.”
“They await your orders my lord,” the messenger stated with a bow.
“Tell them to drive the princess and her followers out,” I smirked, “If their…generous…host resistances execute him...no exceptions.”
The soldier nodded and took once again to relay the message.
“What is you plan Lord Dietrich?” Cao Cao inquired.
“I plan to lead an attack on Xu Chang and kill Sun Quan,” I stated, “and you’ll be leading the attack.”
“What is the exact plan?” Xiahou Yuan asked.
“You’ve captured me,” I chuckled, “and as you’re the lord of Xu Chang Sun Quan should let you in no problem. Sun Quan is too trusting and we will use this to our advantage…you’ve captured me and killed my guards while I was moving to the forward battle positions…you’ve ridden hard to flee from the pursuing forces led by Sepiroth and Genesis…this will cause Sun Quan to focus on the threats outside…not inside. Your forces will revolt alongside my spies within Xu Chang and claim his head. Simple really…as being this far from the front lines enemy reinforcements will be unlikely but I’ll have shadow teams on standby to deal with them if they show…my plan is not perfect but this is the best we can expect at the moment.”
I turned and walked out of the glade and let my thoughts wander…
-Five years previous-
“Dietrich…you’ve been acting strange lately,” Arumat commented as we walked down the hall.
“Haven’t you wondered if she can stop Chaos?” I inquired despondently my white and gold armor gleaming in the sunlight, “She is inexperienced and controlled by her emotions.”
“So the Legendary Holy Paladin of the Sky is worried about losing to Chaos,” Arumat laughed.
“It’s not funny Arumat,” I sighed, “The world is suffering because of this war…because the Princess refuses to go on the offensive.”
“We don’t have the resources to mount an invasion,” Arumat answered worry showing in his eyes, “Are you feeling alright.”
“I’m fine Arumat,” I answered looking out the window, “I’m just afraid…this war will not be won by us at this rate.”
-Present Day-
I felt tears welling in my eyes…Arumat was more than a friend…he was my oath brother…we swore to have each other’s back …and I broke that oath.
“You’re thinking of him again aren’t you my lord,” Genesis asked walking towards me.
“I guess I’m still hoping I can get him to see my point of view,” I stated gazing up at the moon, “Even if he doesn’t join us I just hope he will understand why did what I did…why I abandoned the princess.”
“He will never abandon the princess my lord,” Genesis commented.
“You weren’t there,” I smiled remembering the day I fought my oath brother, “The sorrow in his eyes…it shall forever be etched into my memory.”
-Five year previous (Dietrich’s uprising)-
My blade was still sheathed as I decimated the royal guards as they attempted to defend the princess…I beat them into unconsciousness before I approached her as she sat on her throne glaring at me.
“Why are you betraying me!?” She shouted childishly.
“Because you are not the one to lead us to victory in this war,” I stated calmly, “Step down as leader or I will take it from you by force…no matter how much it pains me…I cannot allow the world to suffer from your ineptitude.”
“I’m your leader how dare you insult me!” she shouted throwing a tantrum.
“You’re a child nothing more,” I stated calmly my soul wrenched with sorrow, “I will ask you once more step down…please.”
“No,” she pouted, “I’m the ruler not you…so there.”
“As you wish,” I sighed stepping towards her, “I will take your throne by force then…in the name of order.”
But before I could even attempt to draw my blade the doors burst open to reveal Arumat his weapon clutched in his hand.
“No…it can’t be…Why Dietrich?” he asked shock and confusion in his eyes.
“I sacrificed my very being for her to lead her armies to victory,” I sighed, “and all she’s done is used as her personal bodyguard…I refuse to allow the world to suffer anymore Arumat…join me…please…”
“No…I can’t,” He stated activating his laser scythe, “I’m sorry but I cannot allow you to live.”
“Don’t disappoint me Arumat…I wish to see if you live up to the name of Death Incarnate,” I smiled drawing my blade and tossing aside the scabbard.
I swung at him and he simply blocked it with the haft of his weapon and smashed me out of the window and onto the roof outside…thunder streaked across the skies as rain began pelting my armor…I rose to my feet and raised my blade as he jumped in front me. We both charged at each other locking our weapons together.
“I’m glad it’s you,” I whispered, “If I’m going to fall today I’m glad it’s at your hands.”
“Same here,” he whispered back sadly, “but I still don’t like this…why are you fighting us.”
“Because…if I don’t then nothing will be done,” I stated calmly, “She is lazy and childish…maybe my betrayal will inspire her to action.”
-Present Day-
“I gave up my wings and my body to aid them,” I sighed gazing up at the moon, “My new form can’t sustain my magical abilities but it can prevent me from dying now.”
“Do you think Arumat knew?” Genesis inquired.
“I doubt it…dragons are rare and I doubt the queen is foolish enough to mention that she misused a dragon’s talents…the people would jump ship in droves,” I smirked, “How was he supposed to know that he swore an oath of brotherhood with a dragon…but that is for another time…we go to battle.”


Notes-
Dietrich-
Race-Human (Dragon)
Bio-He is a dragon that gave up his true form to aid the princess…she is the only one who knows his true form…but when she underused his talents he sought to lead an uprising but his human form is unable to unleash his most powerful abilities without destroying his current body but if he should somehow die he can use his draconic spirit energy to possess a new body and change it to his original human form or recreate his original human body…he is unable to obtain his dragon body. The only way to stop him is by capturing his spirit. He is Oath Brothers with Arumat. His spies are everywhere so very little ever escapes his attention.

Arumat-
Race-Eldarian (See Star Ocean: Last Hope)
Bio-He is the current Supreme Commander of the good forces and acts as both the princess’s body guard and the White Knight’s Mentor…
(For more information look up Arumat from Star Ocean: Last Hope)
15521112.title: Cao Cao wishes to discuss his surrender (darthv...

1552112.content:
The White Night was running along down the corridors, following Arumat and the princess. However, his mind was elsewhere. Not only was he worried about the princess, but Arumat was bleeding pretty badly. His mind started to wonder. Where were they going to go? How were they going to keep the princess safe? Were Arumats wounds fatal? Finally he asked the question that everyone was thinking.
"Does anyone know where we're going?" he said, stopping in the middle of the corridor.
The other two paused and turned to look back at him. They turned to look at each other. Before Arumat answered "I may not know were we should go, but I know a place were we can be safe. I have a friend who operates his own sanctuary. He lives alone and runs the place by himself, and he should help us."
" If he remembers you," the Knight continued.
"I sure hope he does, because if he doesn't, and he thinks we are enemies, he can be force to be reckoned with."
"Well then, lead the way my friend," the knight said, a bit of anxiousness in his voice.
When they got out of the corridor and above ground, they to a nearby stable and took three horses and all the appropriate supplies. On the way out, they qll left more than enough money to pay for everything.
It was a full days ride, and when they got there, they were tired and hungry. The first thing they noticed was the perfect squaring of everything. The entire outside wall was made of perfect three foot by three foot blocks of what appeared to be stone bricks. The doors were in a similar faahion, but whith blocks of wooden planks. Arumat walked up to a very square wooden button and pushed it. The sound they heard sounded synthesized. The button wasn't pushed often apparently, because what could then be a heard was a yell and crash, like someone falling off of scaffolding.
There was then the sound of moaning. "Hold on. Hold on. I'll be there shortly," the apparent source of all the commotion said.
"Oh, and just a warning, he can be a little bit wacky," Arumat wispered.
One of the great doors opened, and the thing that appeared before them confused both the white night and the princess. It was a creature made entirely out of blocks. He was six feet tall and appeared to be a machine. His primary colors were blue and silver, with a silver eye rite in the middle of his face. He had silver shark-like fins on the side of his head.
"Hello strangers,"the thing said."The name's Verb."
"Good to see you again old friend," said Arumat.
"Good to see you too,"said Verb, giving Arumat a firm handshake. Despite being made of blocks, Verb could move just like a human.
"May we come in," asked Arumat.
"Certainly. Come in, come in," Verb said with great haste.
Everyone huried in and Verb closed the door. What was on the inside was even stranger than on the outside. It was a huge zoo. No ordinary animals, though. This zoo was populated with everything from dinosaurs to a giant flying blue and black squid in a giant glass bubble.
"Welcome to my humble abode," said Verb, a slight hint of playfullness in his voice. He had no mouth. But his eye was flashing with every sylable.
"Yes, well, it certainly is lovely, but we have more pressing matters to attend to." Arumat said, with a slight sense of urgency."Oh yes, before I forget. These are my associates, the white night and the princess."
Verb took a look at both of them. If he had had a jaw, it would have dropped to the floor. "Oh my goodness. Pardon my memory, your majesty, for I didn't recognize you immediately,"he said, bowing to the princess.
"We have no time for these trivialities. Please, do you have anywhere safe and secure that we can talk,"asked the white night asked urgently.
"Of course I do," Verb replied, a little insulted."Do you think I am an idiot,"
"My apologies," The night said. "Can you take us there now please."
"Most certainly,"Verb replied, leading them off through his park composed entirely of creatures maxe of blocks.
1552112.title: White Knight

1553.content:
Once upon a time, in a land far far away that was high above the clouds currently hovering over a modern day civilization of normal sized people, a completely fat yet friendly good natured giant anthropomorphic cat in this case my original character Mauricio Di Mauro from Wunsch Punsch the animated series was in his castle feeling rather so very lonely since he hardly had any visitors come to his castle until one day Princess Sierra had come to his castle to find him because he was the one hero she was looking for to save the video game world itself.

"This must be the place, Mauricio the giant anthropomorphic cat's castle since he is the biggest hero we'll need if we're to save the video game world itself." Princess Sierra said.

Afterwards, she started hearing gigantic footsteps coming her way and immediately looked up at the completely fat yet friendly giant anthropomorphic cat that was Mauricio himself as he noticed he finally had a visitor and uttered some very familiar lines from Jack and the beanstalk.

"Fe Fi Fo Fum, who are you and what brings you to my castle milady?" Mauricio asked the princess.

"I am Princess Sierra of the video game world itself, and it was foretold in an prophecy from the video game world that you are the chosen one who will save our world from an evil being named Tabuu that's bent on conquering the video game world itself, since you're our last hope." Princess Sierra explained

"I see, so I'm this chosen one that would save your world as your prophecy foretold. And this Tabuu you speak of, you say he's bent on conquering the video game world itself hmm? Well fear not milady since i have meaning to leave this castle and save the video game world as well. Oh before we go, just so you're fully aware some of us giants prefer not to wear any clothes at all, like say you know yours truly." Mauricio said while blushing with a completely embarrassed look on his face.

"Oh very well, i understand. Alright we're off to the video game world to save it." Princess Sierra said while she was chanting something unintelligible as a blinding beam of light transported both our hero and heroine out of the castle and away from Mauricio's home territory.

Soon enough the two eventually ended up arriving at...
1553.title: three

info.brief_description: Tabuu is back, and its up to you to save, or rule, the world!
info.description:
BACKGROUND


There is a prophecy that exists in the area between the limitless universes. It is a simple prophecy, and it is displayed countlessly in various forms. It is the prophecy of the hero, the victim, and the villain. The hero has immense power; though, the hero doesn't necessarily have to be considered "good", they are just merely there at the aid of the victim. The victim is under siege of the villain and seeks the aid of the hero; a victim usually has something or can do something worthwhile that encourages the villain to seek them out. The villain is at war with the hero, trying to maintain control over the victim; not all villains are "evil", they are just against the hero and seek to exploit the victim to achieve some greater purpose.
I am Princess Sierra.
You are our final hope.
